notes.text: Treck Inc.designs and distributes software for real-time operating systems (RTOS) customers worldwide. Treck's sofware provide essential TCP/IP networking capability to these devices. Security researchers from JSOF have discovered a number of vulnerabilities that can have an impact on devices that have adopted Treck's embedded software to cause unexpected behavior and possibly further exploit these devices for nefarious purposes.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text: THIS DOCUMENT IS PROVIDED ON AN "AS IS" BASIS AND DOES NOT IMPLY ANY KIND OF GUARANTEE OR WARRANTY, INCLUDING THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR USE. YOUR USE OF THE INFORMATION ON THE DOCUMENT OR MATERIALS LINKED FROM THE DOCUMENT IS AT YOUR OWN RISK.

document.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in Treck embedded software

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.66 has an Integer Overflow during Memory Allocation that causes an Out-of-Bounds Write.

notes.text: Integer Overflow or Wraparound (CWE-190) in Memory Allocation component.  An unauthorized network attacker can send a malicious packet that may result in corruption of sensitive information, a crash, or code execution on the target device.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.41 has an IPv4 tunneling Double Free.

notes.text: Double Free (CWE-415) in IPv4 tunneling component when handling a packet.  An unauthorized network attacker can use malicious packets that could lead to unexpected behavior of memory access that can be used to write or read values in arbitrary memory spaces.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.66 improperly handles a Length Parameter Inconsistency in TCP.

notes.text: Improper Handling of Length Parameter Inconsistency (CWE-130) in TCP component.  A remote attacker can send a malformed TCP packet that can cause trigger an integer underflow event leading to unexpected behavior of a crash or segmentation fault on the target device.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.66 improperly handles an IPv4/ICMPv4 Length Parameter Inconsistency, which might allow remote attackers to trigger an information leak.

notes.text: Improper Handling of Length Parameter Inconsistency (CWE-130) in IPv4/ICMPv4 component. An unauthorized network attacker can send a malicious request that can lead to unintended exposure of sensitive information on the target device.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.28 has a DHCP Out-of-bounds Read.

notes.text: Out-of-bounds Read (CWE-125) in DHCP component when handling a packet.  A local network attacker can craft a malicious Layer-2 DHCP request that could lead to access of sensitive information on the destination device.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.66 has an IPv4 Integer Underflow.

notes.text:
Improper Input Validation (CWE-20) in IPv4 component.  A remote attacker can send a malformed IPv4 packet that can cause trigger an integer underflow event leading to unexpected behavior of a crash or segmentation fault on the target
device.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.66 has an Ethernet Link Layer Integer Underflow.

notes.text: Improper Input Validation (CWE-20) in Ethernet Link Layer component.  A local network attacker can send a malicious Layer-2 Ethernet packet that can cause trigger an integer underflow event leading to unexpected behavior of a crash or segmentation fault on the target device.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.66 has Improper ICMPv4 Access Control.

notes.text: Improper Access Control (CWE-284) in ICMPv4 component.  An unauthorized network attacker can send a malicious packet that can lead to higher privileges in permissions assignment for critical resources on the destination device.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.66 has a TCP Out-of-bounds Read.

notes.text: Improper Input Validation (CWE-20) in TCP component.  An unauthorized network attacker can send a malicious packet that may expose data that is present outside the bounds of allocated memory.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.66 allows Remote Code Execution, related to IPv4 tunneling.

notes.text: Improper Handling of Length Parameter Inconsistency (CWE-130) in IPv4/UDP component.  An unauthorized network attacker can send a malicious packet that can be used to inject arbitrary code on the target system.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 5.0.1.35 has an Out-of-Bounds Write via multiple malformed IPv6 packets.

notes.text: Improper Handling of Length Parameter Inconsistency (CWE-130) in IPv6 component.  An unauthorized network attacker can send a malicious packet that can lead to out of bounds write on the target device.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.66 has a DHCPv6 Out-of-bounds Read.

notes.text: Out-of-bounds Read (CWE-125) in DHCP component.  A local network attacker can send a malicious Layer-2 DHCP packet that could lead to an unintended exposure of sensitive information on the target device.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 4.7.1.27 mishandles '\0' termination in DHCP.

notes.text: Improper Null Termination (CWE-170) in DHCP component. A local network attacker can send a malicious Layer-2 DHCP packet that could lead to an unintended exposure of sensitive information on the target device.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.66 has an IPv6 Out-of-bounds Read.

notes.text: Improper Input Validation (CWE-20) in IPv6 component.  An unauthorized network attacker can send a malicious packet that may expose data that is present outside the bounds of allocated memory.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.66 allows Remote Code execution via a single invalid DNS response.

notes.text: Improper Input Validation (CWE-20) in DNS resolver component when handling a packet sent.  An unauthorized network attacker can inject arbitrary code on the target system using a maliciously crafted packet.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.66 has an IPv6 Out-of-bounds Read.

notes.text:
Improper Input Validation (CWE-20) in IPv6 component when handling a packet sent by an unauthorized network attacker.  An unauthorized network attacker can send a malicious request that can lead to out of bounds read on the
target device.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.66 has an ARP Out-of-bounds Read.

notes.text: Improper Input Validation (CWE-20) in ARP component.  A local network attacker can send a malicious Layer-2 ARP packet that could lead to an unintended exposure of sensitive information on the target device.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.66 has an IPv6OverIPv4 tunneling Out-of-bounds Read.

notes.text: Improper Input Validation (CWE-20) in IPv6overIPv4 tunneling component.  An unauthorized network attacker can send a malicious packet that may expose data that is present outside the bounds of allocated memory.

vulnerabilities.title: The Treck TCP/IP stack before 6.0.1.66 has an ICMPv4 Out-of-bounds Read.

notes.text: Improper Input Validation (CWE-20) in ICMPv4 component.  An unauthorized network attacker can send a malicious packet that may expose data that is present outside the bounds of allocated memory.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds read in DHCPv6 subsystem in Intel(R) AMT and Intel(R)ISM versions before 11.8.77, 11.12.77, 11.22.77, 12.0.64 and 14.0.33 may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via network access.

notes.text: Out-of-bounds Read (CWE-125) in DHCP component.  A local network attacker can send a malicious Layer-2 DHCP packet that could lead to an unintended exposure of sensitive information on the target device. This is Intel's version of CVE-2020-11905

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds read in IPv6 subsystem in Intel(R) AMT and Intel(R) ISM versions before 14.0.33 may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via network access.

notes.text:
Improper Input Validation (CWE-20) in IPv6 component when handling a packet sent by an unauthorized network attacker.  An unauthorized network attacker can send a malicious request that can lead to out of bounds read on the
target device.  Intel's specific implementation CVE for CVE-2020-11899

vulnerabilities.title: Use after free in IPv6 subsystem in Intel(R) AMT and Intel(R) ISM versions before 11.8.77, 11.12.77, 11.22.77 and 12.0.64 may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via network access.

notes.text: Double Free (CWE-415) in IPv4 tunneling component when handling a packet.  An unauthorized network attacker can use malicious packets that could lead to unexpected behavior of memory access that can be used to write or read values in arbitrary memory spaces.  This is Intel's version of CVE-2020-11900

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds read in IPv6 subsystem in Intel(R) AMT and Intel(R) ISM versions before 11.8.77, 11.12.77, 11.22.77 and 12.0.64 may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via network access.

notes.text:
Improper Input Validation (CWE-20) in IPv6 component when handling a packet sent by an unauthorized network attacker.  An unauthorized network attacker can send a malicious request that can lead to out of bounds read on the
target device. Intel obtained this CVE for CVE-2020-11899 , specific to their environment.

branches.name: Multiple vulnerabilities in Treck embedded software

product.name: Unknown Multiple vulnerabilities in Treck embedded software < 6.0.1
